segments.text: Tommy played truant today . His teacher called me this morning .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I've asked him , but he won't tell me . What should we do about this ? He is like you . I remember when we were at the college , you always skipped classes .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Like me ? But you see I am so successful now . And if he is really like me , he will be more successful than me in the future .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Stop , stop ... We are talking about our son's attendance for classes and his study . Maybe we could give him a little bit money to pay to go to school .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Pay him ? But he studies for himself , not for you or for me or for anybody else . I got an idea . You should send him to class every morning and after the class begins , you can go to work .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: In that way , I'll be late every day . How about letting him go to school on school bus ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's a good idea . Why have I never thought of that ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's because I went to school for each class when I was at school . So now I am much more clever than you .
segments.speaker: S1
